trans-unit.source: The Domain Name System (DNS) is used to locate things on the internet.
trans-unit.target: The Domain Name System (DNS) is used to locate things on the internet.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you enter an address in your browser, or click a link on a web page, it uses DNS to translate the domain into an IP address.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you enter an address in your browser, or click a link on a web page, it uses DNS to translate the domain into an IP address.

trans-unit.source: The IP address is sort of like a street address, but it's not very human friendly.
trans-unit.target: The IP address is sort of like a street address, but it's not very human friendly.

trans-unit.source: For example, it is much easier to remember a DNS name like **contoso.com** than it is to remember an IP address such as 192.168.1.88 or 2001:0:4137:1f67:24a2:3888:9cce:fea3.
trans-unit.target: For example, it is much easier to remember a DNS name like **contoso.com** than it is to remember an IP address such as 192.168.1.88 or 2001:0:4137:1f67:24a2:3888:9cce:fea3.

trans-unit.source: The DNS system is based on *records*.
trans-unit.target: The DNS system is based on *records*.

trans-unit.source: Records associate a specific *name*, such as **contoso.com**, with either an IP address or another DNS name.
trans-unit.target: Records associate a specific *name*, such as **contoso.com**, with either an IP address or another DNS name.

trans-unit.source: When an application, such as a web browser, looks up a name in DNS, it finds the record, and uses whatever it points to as the address.
trans-unit.target: When an application, such as a web browser, looks up a name in DNS, it finds the record, and uses whatever it points to as the address.

trans-unit.source: If the value it points to is an IP address, the browser will use that value.
trans-unit.target: If the value it points to is an IP address, the browser will use that value.

trans-unit.source: If it points to another DNS name, then the application has to do resolution again.
trans-unit.target: If it points to another DNS name, then the application has to do resolution again.

trans-unit.source: Ultimately, all name resolution will end in an IP address.
trans-unit.target: Ultimately, all name resolution will end in an IP address.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure Website, a DNS name is automatically assigned to the site.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure Website, a DNS name is automatically assigned to the site.

trans-unit.source: This name takes the form of **<yoursitename>.azurewebsites.net**.
trans-unit.target: This name takes the form of **<yoursitename>.azurewebsites.net**.

trans-unit.source: When you add your website as an Azure Traffic Manager endpoint, your website is then accessible through the **<yourtrafficmanagerprofile>.trafficmanager.net** domain.
trans-unit.target: When you add your website as an Azure Traffic Manager endpoint, your website is then accessible through the **<yourtrafficmanagerprofile>.trafficmanager.net** domain.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When your website is configured as a Traffic Manager endpoint, you will use the **.trafficmanager.net** address when creating DNS records.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When your website is configured as a Traffic Manager endpoint, you will use the **.trafficmanager.net** address when creating DNS records.

trans-unit.source: You can only use CNAME records with Traffic Manager
trans-unit.target: You can only use CNAME records with Traffic Manager

trans-unit.source: There are also multiple types of records, each with their own functions and limitations, but for websites configured to as Traffic Manager endpoints, we only care about one; *CNAME* records.
trans-unit.target: There are also multiple types of records, each with their own functions and limitations, but for websites configured to as Traffic Manager endpoints, we only care about one; *CNAME* records.

trans-unit.source: CNAME or Alias record
trans-unit.target: CNAME or Alias record

trans-unit.source: A CNAME record maps a *specific* DNS name, such as **mail.contoso.com** or **www.contoso.com**, to another (canonical) domain name.
trans-unit.target: A CNAME record maps a *specific* DNS name, such as **mail.contoso.com** or **www.contoso.com**, to another (canonical) domain name.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Azure Websites using Traffic Manager, the canonical domain name is the **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name of your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Azure Websites using Traffic Manager, the canonical domain name is the **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name of your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name.
trans-unit.target: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name.

trans-unit.source: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name automatically, so if the IP address of the website changes, you do not have to take any action.
trans-unit.target: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your **<myapp>.trafficmanager.net** domain name automatically, so if the IP address of the website changes, you do not have to take any action.

trans-unit.source: Once traffic arrives at Traffic Manager, it then routes the traffic to your website, using the load balancing method it is configured for.
trans-unit.target: Once traffic arrives at Traffic Manager, it then routes the traffic to your website, using the load balancing method it is configured for.

trans-unit.source: This is completely transparent to visitors to your website.
trans-unit.target: This is completely transparent to visitors to your website.

trans-unit.source: They will only see the custom domain name in their browser.
trans-unit.target: They will only see the custom domain name in their browser.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as **www.contoso.com**, and not root names, such as **contoso.com**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as **www.contoso.com**, and not root names, such as **contoso.com**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record, or the IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification document.
trans-unit.target: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record, or the IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification document.
